Interface CanonicalBasis

All Known Implementing Classes:
Basis
public interface CanonicalBasis
This interface represents the 'contract' obeyed by a canonical basis in cladosG. Most of the interface focuses upon gettor methods that return blade information, but there are a few convenience methods too that support grade information and ranges as detected by the number of generators found in a blade. Finally there are also a few methods for dealing with keys and basis size validation.

The farther one gets from basic methods dealing with blades and span, the more one is wandering off into conveniences. The various keys matter, but as computational short-cuts for product tables having to deal with very large vector spaces.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Dr Alfred W Differ

  • Method Details

    • validateSize

      static boolean validateSize(int pGens)
      This method detects whether or not the number of generators being used is currently supported by Clados. The point for it is to prevent internal errors in other classes.
      For example, someone attempting to create a basis with a negative number of generators should be stopped up front without having to check for that situation themselves.
      The trickier one, though, involves a number of generators that will blow up an internal representation in a basis or CliffordProduct class. For example, trying to build a basis with 64 generators will create a list of 2E64 blades... or at least the library will try if the size isn't validated first. Perhaps the list representation of a Basis can hold that many Blades, but the keys identifying them might not if they rely on java primitives. Also, the related CliffordProduct holds a product table of all blades. Its internal representation might break too.
      This method provides a single place to validate the largest possible grade of a basis. Having it be static avoids having this test be specialized for each Basis object. This version AVOIDS placing magic numbers in the interface or objects. Actual limits are in the CladosConstant class as static elements.
      Parameters:
      pGens - int This is the number of generators of the basis.
      Returns:
      TRUE returned if the number of generators is in the supported range. FALSE otherwise.

    • bladeOfGradeStream

      Stream<Blade> bladeOfGradeStream(byte pIn)
      In support of streams, a basis should offer a stream of its blades of a particular grade.
      Parameters:
      pIn - byte integer for magnitude of grade of blades in stream.
      Returns:
      Stream of Blades in the basis of a particular grade.

    • bladeStream

      Stream<Blade> bladeStream()
      In support of streams, a basis should offer a stream of its blades.
      Returns:
      Stream of Blades in the basis

    • find

      int find(Blade pIn)
      Old-fashioned 'find' method that reports index location in the basis where a Blade is found OR -1 if it wasn't found.
      Parameters:
      pIn - Blade to be found
      Returns:
      integer index pointing to element of a list containing the Blade OR -1 if the blade wasn't found.

    • getBladeCount

      int getBladeCount()
      Return the number of independent blades in the basis. This is the same as the linear dimension of an algebra that uses this basis.
      Returns:
      int

    • getBladeSet

      EnumSet<Generator> getBladeSet(int p1)
      There is a similar sounding method in the old basis that isn't being used, so it is replaced by this one that returns the enumerated set of generators in the requested blade.
      Parameters:
      p1 - integer pointing to the blade in the internal list
      Returns:
      EnumSet of Generator representing the blade without the context necessary for knowing much about the enclosing space for the blade.

    • getGradeCount

      byte getGradeCount()
      Return the number of grades in the basis. Since there is no geometry in the basis this is a measure of the number of distinct generator subset types that can be formed where the element count determines the type. Because the empty set includes no generators, GradeCount will always be one more than the number of generators.
      Returns:
      byte

    • getGrades

      ArrayList<Integer> getGrades()
      This method simply delivers the otherwise private grade range list. Useful for testing purposes, but should be avoided as much as possible.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Integers A list of grades boxed as Integers.

    • getGradeStart

      int getGradeStart(byte p1)
      Get an index to the first blade of grade specified by the parameter.
      Parameters:
      p1 - byte This is for choosing which grade index range to return.
      Returns:
      int Index within the basis where requested grade starts.

    • getKey

      long getKey(int p1)
      Return the long at p1 in the EddingtonKey array.
      Parameters:
      p1 - short This is the desired key at p1 .
      Returns:
      long

    • getPScalarBlade

      Blade getPScalarBlade()
      This is a short-hand method for getSingleBlade('last'). It just returns the last blade in the basis.
      Returns:
      Blade that is the last in the basis

    • getPScalarStart

      int getPScalarStart()
      This is a special version of getGradeStart() that finds the highest grade.
      Returns:
      int Index within the basis where pscalar grade starts.

    • getScalarBlade

      Blade getScalarBlade()
      This is a short-hand method for getSingleBlade(0). It just returns the first blade in the basis.
      Returns:
      Blade that is the first in the basis

    • getSingleBlade

      Blade getSingleBlade(int p1)
      Simple gettor method retrieves the Blade at the indexed position in the Basis.
      Parameters:
      p1 - integer index
      Returns:
      Blade at the indexed position.

    • gradeStream

      IntStream gradeStream()
      This should essentially be an integer stream, but grades are very small. The maximum grade in a basis is equal to the number of generators used to create it. For now, a single byte integer suffices, but IntStream is better supported by Java.
      Returns:
      Stream of Grades in the basis

    • hasBlade

      boolean hasBlade(Blade pB)
      This method should answer the question whether the offered blade is in the basis. How it does so is up to the concrete class to decide, but the usual way involves testing for keys in a list or map containing the blades of the basis.
      Parameters:
      pB - Blade to be checked if it is in the basis.
      Returns:
      boolean answering true of false about whether the blade is in the basis

    • keyStream

      LongStream keyStream()
      Similar to bladestream(), this method returns a stream of boxed long integers that represents blade keys.
      Returns:
      LongStream of blade keys.

    • validateBladeIndex

      boolean validateBladeIndex(int pIn)
      This is a validator detects blade out of range issues. If one tries to name a blade by its index, it is always possible for the offered integer to be out of range.
      This method demands a contract term for validating the blade index to be referenced. It is NOT static because the maximum grade of a basis is object dependent. Implementations of this method should AVOID placing magic numbers in the method body by using CladosConstant static elements like validateSize(int) does.
      Parameters:
      pIn - Integer representing the integer index of the blade
      Returns:
      boolean True if parameter in the supported range [0, bladeCount]

    • validateGradeIndex

      boolean validateGradeIndex(int pIn)
      This validator detects grade out of range issues. If one tries to name a grade by its index, it is always possible for the offered integer to be out of range.
      This method demands a contract term for validating the grade index to be referenced. It is NOT static because the maximum blade of a basis is object dependent. Implementations of this method should AVOID placing magic numbers in the method body by using CladosConstant static elements like validateSize(int) does.
      Parameters:
      pIn - Integer representing the integer index of the grade
      Returns:
      boolean True if parameter in the supported range [0, gradeCount]
